markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 4"
    pfs=""
>
[Extraction Cauldron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1706)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Blood Lords</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #182: Graveclaw](/Sources.aspx?ID=143) pg. 75

**Price** 85 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** 6
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This large magical stew pot can boil objects down to their valuable components, greatly assisting anyone who wants to harvest raw materials without visiting a settlement. The cauldron is roughly 3 feet in diameter.

**Activate** <actions string="Three Actions" /> Interact;    **Requirements** The cauldron must be filled with boiling water for at least 1 hour; **Effect** As you stir the cauldron, one object that has been in it for at least an hour transforms into raw materials with a value of one half the object's Price; art objects are instead transformed into raw materials with a value equal to their Price. The cauldron produces raw materials associated with the object but unaffected by immersion in boiling water. For example, a magical broom might be rendered into a block of dense, valuable wood, while a gilt-edged portrait might be transformed into a lump of gold. Objects removed from the cauldron before an hour passes can't be transformed and they might be damaged or ruined by water and heat.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Extraction Cauldron
